justification: B doesn’t need a TE upgrade: they have a Tier 1 (Walker, doubtful) and a Tier 2 (Allen). Justin Wright is Tier 5, out, declining role, and tough playoff matchups—contrary to B’s consensus-driven, upside-focused approach. A is conservative and injury-averse yet targets Malik White (questionable, committee, declining role), not a steady workhorse. The rationale is terse and mislabels Wright as a breakout. Offer is unlikely and internally inconsistent.
